comment.author: 19909418@N05
comment._content: Amazing to see the same kind of desks and benches, used here in 1918, that we had in elementary school in Rotterdam during the 50s.

comment.author: 42348892@N04
comment._content: Why were they having lessons in the cold? Was it an experiment to see if it improved teaching and learning, compared with being indoors? or perhaps there was no indoors?

comment.author: 29998366@N02
comment._content:
@ Corky:
The idea of open-air schools goes back to the beginning of the 20th century. It was supposed that lessons in the open air would prevent the development of tuberculosis in children.

comment.author: 22408734@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Holland before the year 1920 / Nederland van vóór 1920, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 98338006@N00
comment._content: ik dacht: dit is duin-vegetatie, en dan een minuut zoeken en kwatta! www.iisg.nl/today/nl/11-12.php zelfde stoepje, zelfde kloeke struik..
